channel.title: Homes on Linlin Chen @ IIT
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Linlin Chen @ IIT

item.description: Biography Greetings! My name is Linlin Chen. I am now a third year Ph.D student at Department of Computer Science, Illinois Institute of Technology(IIT). I am supervised by Prof. Xiang-Yang Li and Prof. Peng-Jun Wan. My research interests span in data privacy & security, deep learning, machine learning, mobile computing. I like taking challenges and solving practical problems. I received my Bachelor of Engineering degree from the School of Computer Science, University of Science and Technology of China(USTC).

item.title: Experience
item.description: Research Assistant WINET Lab lab @ IIT, supervised by Peng-Jun Wan, Aug. 2016 - Present WINET Lab lab @ IIT, supervised by Prof. Xiang-Yang Li, Aug. 2015 - May. 2016 LINKE Lab @ USTC, , Supervised by Prof. Xiang-Yang Li, Summer, 2016 & 2017 UBRI Lab @ USTC, Supervised by Prof. Huanhuan Chen, Sept. 2013 - Dec. 2014 Multi-Agent System Lab @ USTC, Supervised by Prof. Xiaoping Chen, Sept.

item.description: &copy FYI: The following materials are copyrighted by the corresponding publishers. I download them from the Internet and attach some PDF files only for self-studying and research. If any violations exist, please contact me to delete. 1. Papers     1.1 Deep Learning     1.2 Data Privacy & Security     1.3 Mobile Computing     1.4 Learning & Security 2.
